a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:5:"title";s:46:"Demo Reading Passage - World Population Growth";s:7:"content";s:422:"Global population patterns show interesting trends. In 1950, the world population was 2.5 billion. By 2000, it had reached 6 billion, and current estimates place it at approximately 8 billion. The fastest growth occurred in Asia, which houses 60% of the global population. Africa is experiencing rapid growth with a current population of 1.4 billion. Europe has a relatively stable population of around 750 million people.";}}
